TITLE: Why the father of 'life planning' says you're managing money the wrong way
SUMMARY: George Kinder, recognized as the founder of financial life planning, thinks consumers are shortchanging themselves by putting off goals until retirement age.

TITLE: 'The starving artist' is a myth, author says: Here's what it takes for creatives to sustain a career
SUMMARY: In Stacey D'Erasmo's new book, "The Long Run," she interviews artists who are late in their careers to find out how they stuck with their work over decades.

TITLE: U.S. job market slows, but it's not yet a 'three-alarm fire,' economist says
SUMMARY: The labor market has shown unambiguous signs of cooling, economists said. Recession could follow if the trajectory continues.

TITLE: For online shoppers, Friday is the best day to score a discount, report finds
SUMMARY: Online shopping discounts reach their peak on Fridays, a recent report found. Here's how to make the most of the deals while avoiding the pitfalls of "spaving."

TITLE: Harris wants a 28% capital gains tax rate for top earners. Here's what advisors are telling clients
SUMMARY: Kamala Harris proposed a 28% tax on long-term capital gains for households making more than $1 million. Here's what financial advisors recommend.

TITLE: These are the top 10 highest-paying college majors — two have six-figure starting salaries
SUMMARY: When it comes to the highest-paying bachelor’s degrees, engineering and other STEM-related fields of study continue to dominate.

TITLE: How high earners can funnel money to a Roth IRA, the 'gold standard' of retirement accounts
SUMMARY: High earners may find it tricky to access tax breaks in individual retirement accounts. A workaround may help.

TITLE: Here's what Harris' plan to tax unrealized investment gains means for the wealthiest Americans
SUMMARY: Vice President Kamala Harris has endorsed Biden's plan to tax unrealized gains on wealth exceeding $100 million, also known as the billionaire minimum tax.

TITLE: Seven Republican-led states sue to block Biden's sweeping student loan forgiveness plan
SUMMARY: Seven Republican-led states sued the Education Department to try to block the Biden administration from carrying out its new student loan forgiveness plan.

TITLE: Cooper Union college restores free tuition for graduating seniors
SUMMARY: The college is working its way back to providing full-tuition scholarships for every student — a promise it was founded on.

TITLE: 40% of workers are behind on retirement planning. Not saving earlier was the biggest mistake
SUMMARY: Four in 10 American workers are behind on retirement planning and savings, a CNBC survey finds. Not starting earlier tops Americans' greatest financial regrets.

TITLE: Relocating retirees want lower costs of living and better lifestyles. Moving abroad may be the answer
SUMMARY: Some seniors are lowering expenses and boosting their quality of life by retiring abroad. Here's what retirees need to know before making the leap.

TITLE: 44% of workers are 'cautiously optimistic' about meeting retirement goals, CNBC poll finds. Here are key planning steps at every age
SUMMARY: The decline in pensions, the rising cost of health care and increasing life expectancy have contributed to workers' need to rethink retirement plans.

TITLE: Younger retirees can face a 'phantom tax' on  Marketplace health insurance — here's how to avoid it
SUMMARY: Younger retirees can face a 'phantom tax' on Marketplace health insurance. Here's how to avoid it, according to financial experts.

TITLE: Biden may start forgiving student debt in October
SUMMARY: President Joe Biden may try to forgive student debt again as early as next month, in a sweeping redo effort that could impact tens of millions of Americans.

TITLE: 'Rush' hour isn’t what it used to be. Working 10-to-4 is the new 9-to-5, commuting data shows
SUMMARY: A shorter workday has become the "new normal," according to a recent report.

TITLE: American demand for international trips drives 'travel momentum' and overall spending
SUMMARY: Americans' spending on international trips has underpinned overall travel strength.

TITLE: A recession could upend plans for people approaching retirement. Taking these steps can help, experts say
SUMMARY: Retirees and near-retirees perhaps face the biggest risks if an economic downturn upends their financial plans. Experts say these are the questions to ask now.

TITLE: The 'rent-first' lifestyle is catching on. From cars to clothes and even caskets, here's when it makes sense to buy vs. rent
SUMMARY: Younger adults are showing a preference for the renting lifestyle, studies show. In some cases, it also makes financial sense.

TITLE: About 1.4 million Medicare prescription plan participants will save $1,000-plus each year with new out-of-pocket cap starting in 2025
SUMMARY: Retirees covered by Medicare Part D are set to see new relief from high prescription drug costs in 2025. New research estimates how much they may save.

TITLE: Mortgage rates are falling, improving home buying conditions. Here's what to know before you act
SUMMARY: Experts give their best advice for navigating the housing market in the months ahead.

TITLE: Taxes may be a blind spot in your investment portfolio
SUMMARY: Asset location, which aims to boost after-tax returns, is perhaps just as important as asset allocation for many investors.

TITLE: Here's what to consider if you're actively looking for a job this fall, experts say
SUMMARY: The fall season can be a good time to maximize your search for a new job. Here's how to do it.

TITLE: 401(k) auto-enrollment features don’t help savings as much as expected, study finds
SUMMARY: Academics who helped pioneer research on 401(k) auto-enrollment find effects such as leakage blunt its long-term impact.

TITLE: Education Department details FAFSA strategy for the year ahead. But, there is still 'potential for chaos,' expert says
SUMMARY: The Education Department said it will beta launch the 2025-26 FAFSA 'to uncover and fix issues' with the aid application.

TITLE: 'NEETs': Why some young adults are disconnected from the job market
SUMMARY: There is a growing share of young adults not working — some feel discouraged by factors beyond their control.

TITLE: The gift of education: Getting friends and family to contribute to your kid’s 529 account is 'pretty darn cool'
SUMMARY: With college affordability now a top concern, saving for higher education is more of a priority. Here's how friends and family can help.

TITLE: Dollar General, Dollar Tree and Kroger customers pay over $90 million a year in cash-back fees, federal agency finds
SUMMARY: Some big retailers have been levying a fee on customers who ask for cash back on purchases. That disproportionately hurts those in banking deserts.

TITLE: Freezing your credit is the first step to avoid identity theft, expert says. Here's what to know
SUMMARY: Recent large consumer data breaches have prompted experts to advise consumers to freeze their credit. Here's how to get started.

TITLE: Top 10 colleges for financial aid, according to The Princeton Review — one is in the Ivy League
SUMMARY: These are the colleges with the most generous financial aid packages, according to The Princeton Review.
